p: When looking at the exploitation of the cod ( Gadus morhua) stock in the Barents Sea, the resilience of the Northern cod fishery is confirmed by archaeological fishbone analyses (Barrett et al. 2008, 2011) showing that dried cod continuously has been exported from the remote sub-Arctic region to other European countries over a period of more than thousand years. This period includes both the Medieval Warm Period (about 900–1400, Stocker et al. 2013), with significantly warmer climate than today, and the Little Ice Age (1450–1850, Stocker et al. 2013), which we temperature wise still are recovering from (Bianchi and McCave 1999).
